passage.text: Mapping of the Mouse Actin Capping Protein Beta Subunit Gene
The CP gene (Cappb1) mapped to Chromosome 4 between Cdc42 and D4Mit312. Three mouse mutations, as well as snubnose, curly tail, and cribriform degeneration, are located in the vicinity of the Gene.

The role of tandem repeats in mammalian genetics and DNA fingerprinting in forensic applications is well-established, with studies emphasizing their importance as markers for identifying pathogenic bacteria.

The number of kinesins in Arabidopsis is surprisingly high compared to the five completed eukaryotic genomes, with some kinezines being absent from yeast, C.elegans and Drosophila, which may represent new subfamilies that are not classified as such.
